revised_title: Evidence for a Peak-Shift in Predator Generalization among Aposematic Prey
tldr: The study investigates predator generalization among aposematic prey and finds evidence for a peak-shift. The research shows that chicks exhibit a greater aversion towards larger, more aposematic prey after one experience of aposematic bugs. This peak-shift phenomenon can help explain the evolution of aposematic strategies in prey species.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Evolutionary Biology
